Canadian Active Neutron Spectrometer (CANS) Phase A

# Tender Notice
**Title:** Canadian Active Neutron Spectrometers (CANS) Phase A
**Tender Number:** WS3873778623
**Tender Amendment Number:** 4
**Date of Publication:** 20 March 2023
**Deadline to Close Tenders:** 23 May 2023, at 14:00 EDT

**Project Overview**
The Canadian Space Agency (CSA) is seeking a contractor to develop a mature set of instrument requirements and a baseline design for flight-quality Canadian Active Neutron Spectrometers (CANS) to be used for radiation monitoring applications on the International Space Station (ISS) and the Lunar Gateway.

**Project Duration and Schedule**
The project consists of an initial Phase A with a duration of 7 months, with the expected start date of 7 July 2023 and end date of 15 January 2024.

**Contract Award Criteria**
The contractor will be selected based on the highest technical merit within a stipulated maximum budget.

**Notice Type and Method of Procurement**
This is a Request for Proposal (RFP) with an open bidding process.

**Contact Information**
For any inquiries or requests for clarification, please contact Cristina Cimpan, Public Works and Government Services Canada, at cristina.cimpan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

**Submission Guidelines**
Tenders must be submitted electronically via SAP Ariba: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15709944 by 23 May 2023, at 14:00 EDT. Tenders received after the deadline will be considered non-responsive.

**Project Requirements**
Détails of the project requirements, scope of work, and evaluation criteria can be found in the Statement of Work (Annex A).

**Background**
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) is acting on behalf of the CSA to procure CANS for radiation monitoring on the ISS and Lunar Gateway. CBC invites interested suppliers to review the project requirements and bid electronically via Ariba Discovery. Please note that the contract period is 7 months.
